13481}
13482#endif
13483
13484void
13485rb_parser_printf(struct parser_params *p, const char *fmt, ...)
13486{
13487 va_list ap;
13488 VALUE mesg = p->debug_buffer;
13489
13490 if (NIL_P(mesg)) p->debug_buffer = mesg = rb_str_new(0, 0);
13491 va_start(ap, fmt);
13492 rb_str_vcatf(mesg, fmt, ap);
13493 va_end(ap);
13494 if (RSTRING_END(mesg)[-1] == '\n') {
13495 rb_io_write(p->debug_output, mesg);
13496 p->debug_buffer = Qnil;
13497 }
13498}
13499
13500static void
13501parser_compile_error(struct parser_params *p, const char *fmt, ...)
13502{
13503 va_list ap;
13504
13505 rb_io_flush(p->debug_output);
13506 p->error_p = 1;
13507 va_start(ap, fmt);
13508 p->error_buffer =
13509 rb_syntax_error_append(p->error_buffer,
13510 p->ruby_sourcefile_string,
13511 p->ruby_sourceline,
13512 rb_long2int(p->lex.pcur - p->lex.pbeg),
13513 p->enc, fmt, ap);
13514 va_end(ap);
13515}
13516
13517static size_t
13518count_char(const char *str, int c)
13519{
13520 int n = 0;
13521 while (str[n] == c) ++n;
13522 return n;
13523}
13524
13525/*
13526 * strip enclosing double-quotes, same as the default yytnamerr except
13527 * for that single-quotes matching back-quotes do not stop stripping.
13528 *
13529 * "\"`class' keyword\"" => "`class' keyword"
13530 */
13531RUBY_FUNC_EXPORTED size_t
13532rb_yytnamerr(struct parser_params *p, char *yyres, const char *yystr)
13533{
13534 if (*yystr == '"') {
13535 size_t yyn = 0, bquote = 0;
13536 const char *yyp = yystr;
13537
13538 while (*++yyp) {
13539 switch (*yyp) {
13540 case '`':
13541 if (!bquote) {
13542 bquote = count_char(yyp+1, '`') + 1;
13543 if (yyres) memcpy(&yyres[yyn], yyp, bquote);
13544 yyn += bquote;
13545 yyp += bquote - 1;
13546 break;
13547 }
13548 goto default_char;
13549
13550 case '\'':
13551 if (bquote && count_char(yyp+1, '\'') + 1 == bquote) {
13552 if (yyres) memcpy(yyres + yyn, yyp, bquote);
13553 yyn += bquote;
13554 yyp += bquote - 1;
13555 bquote = 0;
13556 break;
13557 }
13558 if (yyp[1] && yyp[1] != '\'' && yyp[2] == '\'') {
13559 if (yyres) memcpy(yyres + yyn, yyp, 3);
13560 yyn += 3;
13561 yyp += 2;
13562 break;
13563 }
13564 goto do_not_strip_quotes;
13565
13566 case ',':
13567 goto do_not_strip_quotes;
13568
13569 case '\\':
13570 if (*++yyp != '\\')
13571 goto do_not_strip_quotes;
13572 /* Fall through. */
13573 default_char:
13574 default:
13575 if (yyres)
13576 yyres[yyn] = *yyp;
13577 yyn++;
13578 break;
13579
13580 case '"':
13581 case '\0':
13582 if (yyres)
13583 yyres[yyn] = '\0';
13584 return yyn;
13585 }
13586 }
13587 do_not_strip_quotes: ;
13588 }
13589
13590 if (!yyres) return strlen(yystr);
13591
13592 return (YYSIZE_T)(yystpcpy(yyres, yystr) - yyres);
13593}
13594#endif
13595
13596#ifdef RIPPER
13597#ifdef RIPPER_DEBUG
13598/* :nodoc: */
13599static VALUE
13600ripper_validate_object(VALUE self, VALUE x)
13601{
13602 if (x == Qfalse) return x;
13603 if (x == Qtrue) return x;
13604 if (x == Qnil) return x;
13605 if (x == Qundef)
13606 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "Qundef given");
13607 if (FIXNUM_P(x)) return x;
13608 if (SYMBOL_P(x)) return x;
13609 switch (BUILTIN_TYPE(x)) {
13610 case T_STRING:
13611 case T_OBJECT:
13612 case T_ARRAY:
13613 case T_BIGNUM:
13614 case T_FLOAT:
13615 case T_COMPLEX:
13616 case T_RATIONAL:
13617 break;
13618 case T_NODE:
13619 if (!nd_type_p((NODE *)x, NODE_RIPPER)) {
13620 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "NODE given: %p", (void *)x);
13621 }
13622 x = ((NODE *)x)->nd_rval;
13623 break;
13624 default:
13625 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "wrong type of ruby object: %p (%s)",
13626 (void *)x, rb_obj_classname(x));
13627 }
13628 if (!RBASIC_CLASS(x)) {
13629 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "hidden ruby object: %p (%s)",
13630 (void *)x, rb_builtin_type_name(TYPE(x)));
13631 }
13632 return x;
13633}
13634#endif
13635
13636#define validate(x) ((x) = get_value(x))
13637
13638static VALUE
13639ripper_dispatch0(struct parser_params *p, ID mid)
13640{
13641 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 0);
13642}
13643
13644static VALUE
13645ripper_dispatch1(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a)
13646{
13647 validate(a);
13648 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 1, a);
13649}
13650
13651static VALUE
13652ripper_dispatch2(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a, VALUE b)
13653{
13654 validate(a);
13655 validate(b);
13656 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 2, a, b);
13657}
13658
13659static VALUE
13660ripper_dispatch3(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a, VALUE b, VALUE c)
13661{
13662 validate(a);
13663 validate(b);
13664 validate(c);
13665 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 3, a, b, c);
13666}
13667
13668static VALUE
13669ripper_dispatch4(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a, VALUE b, VALUE c, VALUE d)
13670{
13671 validate(a);
13672 validate(b);
13673 validate(c);
13674 validate(d);
13675 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 4, a, b, c, d);
13676}
13677
13678static VALUE
13679ripper_dispatch5(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a, VALUE b, VALUE c, VALUE d, VALUE e)
13680{
13681 validate(a);
13682 validate(b);
13683 validate(c);
13684 validate(d);
13685 validate(e);
13686 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 5, a, b, c, d, e);
13687}
13688
13689static VALUE
13690ripper_dispatch7(struct parser_params *p, ID mid, VALUE a, VALUE b, VALUE c, VALUE d, VALUE e, VALUE f, VALUE g)
13691{
13692 validate(a);
13693 validate(b);
13694 validate(c);
13695 validate(d);
13696 validate(e);
13697 validate(f);
13698 validate(g);
13699 return rb_funcall(p->value, mid, 7, a, b, c, d, e, f, g);
13700}
13701
13702static ID
13703ripper_get_id(VALUE v)
13704{
13705 NODE *nd;
13706 if (!RB_TYPE_P(v, T_NODE)) return 0;
13707 nd = (NODE *)v;
13708 if (!nd_type_p(nd, NODE_RIPPER)) return 0;
13709 return nd->nd_vid;
13710}
13711
13712static VALUE
13713ripper_get_value(VALUE v)
13714{
13715 NODE *nd;
13716 if (v == Qundef) return Qnil;
13717 if (!RB_TYPE_P(v, T_NODE)) return v;
13718 nd = (NODE *)v;
13719 if (!nd_type_p(nd, NODE_RIPPER)) return Qnil;
13720 return nd->nd_rval;
13721}
13722
13723static void
13724ripper_error(struct parser_params *p)
13725{
13726 p->error_p = TRUE;
13727}
13728
13729static void
13730ripper_compile_error(struct parser_params *p, const char *fmt, ...)
13731{
13732 VALUE str;
13733 va_list args;
13734
13735 va_start(args, fmt);
13736 str = rb_vsprintf(fmt, args);
13737 va_end(args);
13738 rb_funcall(p->value, rb_intern("compile_error"), 1, str);
13739 ripper_error(p);
13740}
13741
13742static VALUE
13743ripper_lex_get_generic(struct parser_params *p, VALUE src)
13744{
13745 VALUE line = rb_funcallv_public(src, id_gets, 0, 0);
13746 if (!NIL_P(line) && !RB_TYPE_P(line, T_STRING)) {
13747 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError,
13748 "gets returned %"PRIsVALUE" (expected String or nil)",
13749 rb_obj_class(line));
13750 }
13751 return line;
13752}
13753
13754static VALUE
13755ripper_lex_io_get(struct parser_params *p, VALUE src)
13756{
13757 return rb_io_gets(src);
13758}
13759
13760static VALUE
13761ripper_s_allocate(VALUE klass)
13762{
13763 struct parser_params *p;
13764 VALUE self = TypedData_Make_Struct(klass, struct parser_params,
13765 &parser_data_type, p);
13766 p->value = self;
13767 return self;
13768}
13769
13770#define ripper_initialized_p(r) ((r)->lex.input != 0)
13771
13772/*
13773 * call-seq:
13774 * Ripper.new(src, filename="(ripper)", lineno=1) -> ripper
13775 *
13776 * Create a new Ripper object.
13777 * _src_ must be a String, an IO, or an Object which has #gets method.
13778 *
13779 * This method does not starts parsing.
13780 * See also Ripper#parse and Ripper.parse.
13781 */
13782static VALUE
13783ripper_initialize(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE self)
13784{
13785 struct parser_params *p;
13786 VALUE src, fname, lineno;
13787
13788 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13789 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "12", &src, &fname, &lineno);
13790 if (RB_TYPE_P(src, T_FILE)) {
13791 p->lex.gets = ripper_lex_io_get;
13792 }
13793 else if (rb_respond_to(src, id_gets)) {
13794 p->lex.gets = ripper_lex_get_generic;
13795 }
13796 else {
13797 StringValue(src);
13798 p->lex.gets = lex_get_str;
13799 }
13800 p->lex.input = src;
13801 p->eofp = 0;
13802 if (NIL_P(fname)) {
13803 fname = STR_NEW2("(ripper)");
13804 OBJ_FREEZE(fname);
13805 }
13806 else {
13807 StringValueCStr(fname);
13808 fname = rb_str_new_frozen(fname);
13809 }
13810 parser_initialize(p);
13811
13812 p->ruby_sourcefile_string = fname;
13813 p->ruby_sourcefile = RSTRING_PTR(fname);
13814 p->ruby_sourceline = NIL_P(lineno) ? 0 : NUM2INT(lineno) - 1;
13815
13816 return Qnil;
13817}
13818
13819static VALUE
13820ripper_parse0(VALUE parser_v)
13821{
13822 struct parser_params *p;
13823
13824 TypedData_Get_Struct(parser_v, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13825 parser_prepare(p);
13826 p->ast = rb_ast_new();
13827 ripper_yyparse((void*)p);
13828 rb_ast_dispose(p->ast);
13829 p->ast = 0;
13830 return p->result;
13831}
13832
13833static VALUE
13834ripper_ensure(VALUE parser_v)
13835{
13836 struct parser_params *p;
13837
13838 TypedData_Get_Struct(parser_v, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13839 p->parsing_thread = Qnil;
13840 return Qnil;
13841}
13842
13843/*
13844 * call-seq:
13845 * ripper.parse
13846 *
13847 * Start parsing and returns the value of the root action.
13848 */
13849static VALUE
13850ripper_parse(VALUE self)
13851{
13852 struct parser_params *p;
13853
13854 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13855 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13856 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13857 }
13858 if (!NIL_P(p->parsing_thread)) {
13859 if (p->parsing_thread == rb_thread_current())
13860 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "Ripper#parse is not reentrant");
13861 else
13862 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "Ripper#parse is not multithread-safe");
13863 }
13864 p->parsing_thread = rb_thread_current();
13865 rb_ensure(ripper_parse0, self, ripper_ensure, self);
13866
13867 return p->result;
13868}
13869
13870/*
13871 * call-seq:
13872 * ripper.column -> Integer
13873 *
13874 * Return column number of current parsing line.
13875 * This number starts from 0.
13876 */
13877static VALUE
13878ripper_column(VALUE self)
13879{
13880 struct parser_params *p;
13881 long col;
13882
13883 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13884 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13885 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13886 }
13887 if (NIL_P(p->parsing_thread)) return Qnil;
13888 col = p->lex.ptok - p->lex.pbeg;
13889 return LONG2NUM(col);
13890}
13891
13892/*
13893 * call-seq:
13894 * ripper.filename -> String
13895 *
13896 * Return current parsing filename.
13897 */
13898static VALUE
13899ripper_filename(VALUE self)
13900{
13901 struct parser_params *p;
13902
13903 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13904 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13905 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13906 }
13907 return p->ruby_sourcefile_string;
13908}
13909
13910/*
13911 * call-seq:
13912 * ripper.lineno -> Integer
13913 *
13914 * Return line number of current parsing line.
13915 * This number starts from 1.
13916 */
13917static VALUE
13918ripper_lineno(VALUE self)
13919{
13920 struct parser_params *p;
13921
13922 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13923 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13924 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13925 }
13926 if (NIL_P(p->parsing_thread)) return Qnil;
13927 return INT2NUM(p->ruby_sourceline);
13928}
13929
13930/*
13931 * call-seq:
13932 * ripper.state -> Integer
13933 *
13934 * Return scanner state of current token.
13935 */
13936static VALUE
13937ripper_state(VALUE self)
13938{
13939 struct parser_params *p;
13940
13941 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13942 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13943 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13944 }
13945 if (NIL_P(p->parsing_thread)) return Qnil;
13946 return INT2NUM(p->lex.state);
13947}
13948
13949/*
13950 * call-seq:
13951 * ripper.token -> String
13952 *
13953 * Return the current token string.
13954 */
13955static VALUE
13956ripper_token(VALUE self)
13957{
13958 struct parser_params *p;
13959 long pos, len;
13960
13961 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct parser_params, &parser_data_type, p);
13962 if (!ripper_initialized_p(p)) {
13963 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "method called for uninitialized object");
13964 }
13965 if (NIL_P(p->parsing_thread)) return Qnil;
13966 pos = p->lex.ptok - p->lex.pbeg;
13967 len = p->lex.pcur - p->lex.ptok;
13968 return rb_str_subseq(p->lex.lastline, pos, len);
13969}
13970
13971#ifdef RIPPER_DEBUG
13972/* :nodoc: */
13973static VALUE
13974ripper_assert_Qundef(VALUE self, VALUE obj, VALUE msg)
13975{
13976 StringValue(msg);
13977 if (obj == Qundef) {
13978 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "%"PRIsVALUE, msg);
13979 }
13980 return Qnil;
13981}
13982
13983/* :nodoc: */
13984static VALUE
13985ripper_value(VALUE self, VALUE obj)
13986{
13987 return ULONG2NUM(obj);
13988}
13989#endif
13990
13991/*
13992 * call-seq:
13993 * Ripper.lex_state_name(integer) -> string
13994 *
13995 * Returns a string representation of lex_state.
13996 */
13997static VALUE
13998ripper_lex_state_name(VALUE self, VALUE state)
13999{
14000 return rb_parser_lex_state_name(NUM2INT(state));
14001}
14002
14003void
14004Init_ripper(void)
14005{
14006 ripper_init_eventids1();
14007 ripper_init_eventids2();
14008 id_warn = rb_intern_const("warn");
14009 id_warning = rb_intern_const("warning");
14010 id_gets = rb_intern_const("gets");
14011 id_assoc = rb_intern_const("=>");
14012
14013 (void)yystpcpy; /* may not used in newer bison */
14014
14015 InitVM(ripper);
14016}
14017
14018void
14019InitVM_ripper(void)
14020{
14021 VALUE Ripper;
14022
14023 Ripper = rb_define_class("Ripper", rb_cObject);
14024 /* version of Ripper */
14025 rb_define_const(Ripper, "Version", rb_usascii_str_new2(RIPPER_VERSION));
14026 rb_define_alloc_func(Ripper, ripper_s_allocate);
14027 rb_define_method(Ripper, "initialize", ripper_initialize, -1);
14028 rb_define_method(Ripper, "parse", ripper_parse, 0);
14029 rb_define_method(Ripper, "column", ripper_column, 0);
14030 rb_define_method(Ripper, "filename", ripper_filename, 0);
14031 rb_define_method(Ripper, "lineno", ripper_lineno, 0);
14032 rb_define_method(Ripper, "state", ripper_state, 0);
14033 rb_define_method(Ripper, "token", ripper_token, 0);
14034 rb_define_method(Ripper, "end_seen?", rb_parser_end_seen_p, 0);
14035 rb_define_method(Ripper, "encoding", rb_parser_encoding, 0);
14036 rb_define_method(Ripper, "yydebug", rb_parser_get_yydebug, 0);
14037 rb_define_method(Ripper, "yydebug=", rb_parser_set_yydebug, 1);
14038 rb_define_method(Ripper, "debug_output", rb_parser_get_debug_output, 0);
14039 rb_define_method(Ripper, "debug_output=", rb_parser_set_debug_output, 1);
14040 rb_define_method(Ripper, "error?", ripper_error_p, 0);
14041#ifdef RIPPER_DEBUG
14042 rb_define_method(Ripper, "assert_Qundef", ripper_assert_Qundef, 2);
14043 rb_define_method(Ripper, "rawVALUE", ripper_value, 1);
14044 rb_define_method(Ripper, "validate_object", ripper_validate_object, 1);
14045#endif
14046
14047 rb_define_singleton_method(Ripper, "dedent_string", parser_dedent_string, 2);
14048 rb_define_private_method(Ripper, "dedent_string", parser_dedent_string, 2);
14049
14050 rb_define_singleton_method(Ripper, "lex_state_name", ripper_lex_state_name, 1);
14051
14052<% @exprs.each do |expr, desc| -%>
14053 /* <%=desc%> */
14054 rb_define_const(Ripper, "<%=expr%>", INT2NUM(<%=expr%>));
14055<% end %>
14056 ripper_init_eventids1_table(Ripper);
14057 ripper_init_eventids2_table(Ripper);
14058
14059# if 0
14060 /* Hack to let RDoc document SCRIPT_LINES__ */
14061
14062 /*
14063 * When a Hash is assigned to +SCRIPT_LINES__+ the contents of files loaded
14064 * after the assignment will be added as an Array of lines with the file
14065 * name as the key.
14066 */
14067 rb_define_global_const("SCRIPT_LINES__", Qnil);
14068#endif
14069
14070}
14071#endif /* RIPPER */
14072

14076 * c-file-style: "ruby"
14077 * End:
